info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 7:22PM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...An intense snow shower will impact portions of southeastern Missoula, northeastern Granite and southwestern Powell Counties through 800 PM MST... At 720 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking an intense snow shower 15 miles southeast of Bonner-West Riverside, or 21 miles southeast of Missoula, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Moderate to heavy snow. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Rapid reduction of visibility under core of moderate snow. Freeze up sidewalks and roads. Locations impacted include... Drummond, Nimrod, Quigley, Maxville, Hall, and Bearmouth. This includes Interstate 90 between mile markers 125 and 153. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
